command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-SmoDatabaseEncryptionKey -ServerInstance MyServer -DatabaseName AdventureWorks -EncryptionAlgorithm Aes256 -EncryptionType ServerCertificate -EncryptorName MyCert

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add database encryption key to AdventureWorks database.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$DatabaseObject = Get-SmoDatabaseObject -ServerInstance . -DatabaseName AdventureWorks
Add-SmoDatabaseEncryptionKey -DatabaseObject $DatabaseObject -EncryptionAlgorithm Aes256 -EncryptionType ServerCertificate -EncryptorName MyCert

maml:description.maml:para: Create connection string.
Create connection string.
Declares the application workload type when connecting to a database in an SQL Server Availability Group.
Specifies the name of the application associated with the connection string.
The wait time (in seconds) before terminating the attempt to execute a command and generating an error.
The length of time (in seconds) to wait for a connection to the server before terminating the attempt and throwing an exception. Default is 15 seconds.
The number of reconnection attempted after identifying that there was an idle connection failure.
Amount of time (in seconds) between each reconnection attempt after identifying that there was an idle connection failure.
Specifies a user account that has permission to perform this action.
Specifies the name of the database associated with the connection.
Boolean value that indicates whether SQL Server uses SSL encryption for all data sent between the client and server if the server has a certificate installed.
Specifies name or address of the partner server to connect to if the primary server is down.

If your application is connecting to an AlwaysOn availability group (AG) on different subnets, setting MultiSubnetFailover=true provides faster detection of and connection to the (currently) active server.
Specifies the size in bytes of the network packets used to communicate with an instance of SQL Server.
Specifies the name or network address of the instance of SQL Server to connect to.
Indicates whether the channel will be encrypted while bypassing walking the certificate chain to validate trust.
Declares the application workload type when connecting to a database in an SQL Server Availability Group.
Specifies the name of the application associated with the connection string.
The wait time (in seconds) before terminating the attempt to execute a command and generating an error.
The length of time (in seconds) to wait for a connection to the server before terminating the attempt and throwing an exception. Default is 15 seconds.
The number of reconnection attempted after identifying that there was an idle connection failure.
Amount of time (in seconds) between each reconnection attempt after identifying that there was an idle connection failure.
Specifies the name of the database associated with the connection.
Boolean value that indicates whether SQL Server uses SSL encryption for all data sent between the client and server if the server has a certificate installed.
Specifies name or address of the partner server to connect to if the primary server is down.
Indicates whether User ID and Password are specified in the connection (when false) or whether the current Windows account credentials are used for authentication (when true).

If your application is connecting to an AlwaysOn availability group (AG) on different subnets, setting MultiSubnetFailover=true provides faster detection of and connection to the (currently) active server.
Specifies the size in bytes of the network packets used to communicate with an instance of SQL Server.
Specifies the name or network address of the instance of SQL Server to connect to.
Indicates whether the channel will be encrypted while bypassing walking the certificate chain to validate trust.
Declares the application workload type when connecting to a database in an SQL Server Availability Group.
Specifies the name of the application associated with the connection string.
The wait time (in seconds) before terminating the attempt to execute a command and generating an error.
The length of time (in seconds) to wait for a connection to the server before terminating the attempt and throwing an exception. Default is 15 seconds.
The number of reconnection attempted after identifying that there was an idle connection failure.
Amount of time (in seconds) between each reconnection attempt after identifying that there was an idle connection failure.
Specifies a user account that has permission to perform this action.
Specifies the name of the database associated with the connection.
Boolean value that indicates whether SQL Server uses SSL encryption for all data sent between the client and server if the server has a certificate installed.
Specifies name or address of the partner server to connect to if the primary server is down.
Indicates whether User ID and Password are specified in the connection (when false) or whether the current Windows account credentials are used for authentication (when true).

If your application is connecting to an AlwaysOn availability group (AG) on different subnets, setting MultiSubnetFailover=true provides faster detection of and connection to the (currently) active server.
Specifies the size in bytes of the network packets used to communicate with an instance of SQL Server.
Specifies the name or network address of the instance of SQL Server to connect to.

Identifies the client network protocol that is used to connect to SQL Server. If you do not specify a network and you use a local server, shared memory is used. If you do not specify a network and you use a remote server, the one of the configured client protocols is used.

The number of seconds that a statement is attempted to be sent to the server before it fails.

Specifies to trust server certificate.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$DataTable = $DataTableGet-SqlClientDataSet -ServerInstance . -DatabaseName AdventureWorks -SqlCommandText 'SELECT * FROM sys.tables;*' -OutputAs DataTable
Invoke-SqlClientBulkCopy -ServerInstance "MySQLServer" -DatabaseName AdventureWorks -TableName "MyTable" -DataTable $DataTable

dev:remarks.maml:para: Perform bulk copy against AdventureWorks database.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$DataTable = $DataTableGet-SqlClientDataSet -ServerInstance . -DatabaseName AdventureWorks -SqlCommandText 'SELECT * FROM sys.tables;*' -OutputAs DataTable $ConnectionString = 'Data Source=.;Initial Catalog=AdventureWorks;Integrated Security=True;'
Invoke-SqlClientBulkCopy -ConnectionString $ConnectionString -TableName "MyTable" -DataTable $DataTable

dev:remarks.maml:para: Perform bulk copy using connection string.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Rename-SmoDatabaseDataFile -ServerInstance MyServer -DatabaseName AdventureWorks -FileGroupName HL7FG -LogicalFileName HL7 -NewLogicalFileName IPC -NewPhysicalFileName AdventureWorks.ndf

dev:remarks.maml:para: Renames AdventureWorks data file logical and physical file name.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$DatabaseObject = Get-SmoDatabaseObject -ServerInstance . -DatabaseName AdventureWorks
Rename-SmoDatabaseDataFile -DatabaseObject $DatabaseObject -FileGroupName HL7FG -LogicalFileName HL7 -NewLogicalFileName IPC -NewPhysicalFileName AdventureWorks.ndf

dev:remarks.maml:para: Renames data file logical and physical file name using SMO database object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$DatabaseObject = Get-SmoDatabaseObject -ServerInstance . -DatabaseName AdventureWorks $FileGroupObject = $DatabaseObject.FileGroups['PRIMARY']
Rename-SmoDatabaseDataFile -FileGroupObject $FileGroupObject -LogicalFileName HL7 -NewLogicalFileName IPC -NewPhysicalFileName AdventureWorks.ndf

dev:remarks.maml:para: Renames data file logical and physical file name using SMO file group object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Set-SmoDatabaseObjectPermission -ServerInstance MyServer -DatabaseName AdventureWorks -ObjectClass Schema -ObjectName dbo -Permission ALTER -Principal DBUser -Action Grant

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets dbo Schema object permission within the AdventureWorks database.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$PermissionSet = [Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet]::New() [void]$PermissionSet.Add([Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.SMO.ObjectPermission]::ALTER)
Set-SmoDatabaseObjectPermission -ServerInstance MyServer -DatabaseName AdventureWorks -ObjectClass Schema -ObjectName dbo -PermissionSet $PermissionSet -Principal DBUser -Action Grant

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets dbo Schema object permission within the AdventureWorks database with the specified permission set.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$DatabaseObject = Get-SmoDatabaseObject -ServerInstance . -DatabaseName AdventureWorks
Set-SmoDatabaseObjectPermission -DatabaseObject $DatabaseObject -ObjectClass Schema -ObjectName dbo -Permission ALTER -Principal DBUser -Action Grant

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets dbo Schema object permission within using the SMO database object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$DatabaseObject = Get-SmoDatabaseObject -ServerInstance . -DatabaseName AdventureWorks $PermissionSet = [Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ObjectPermissionSet]::New() [void]$PermissionSet.Add([Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.SMO.ObjectPermission]::ALTER)
Set-SmoDatabaseObjectPermission -DatabaseObject $DatabaseObject -ObjectClass Schema -ObjectName dbo -PermissionSet $PermissionSet -Principal DBUser -Action Grant

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets dbo Schema object permission within using the SMO database object with specified permission set.
